title: In the United States, the Israel-Hamas war is dividing Democrats
summary: The suffering endured by the Palestinians puts Joe Biden's administration at odds with the progressive wing of his party, whose influence is increasingly significant.

title: War in Ukraine: Russia's defense industry steps up a gear
summary: The Ukrainian General Staff has admitted that its counter-offensive has failed, and warned its western allies that it is entering a phase of attritional warfare that will benefit its adversary. Tank production in Russia should reach 600 units by December.

title: United States: The auto strike brings victories for both unionized workers and Southern states
summary: The agreement signed by the three major automakers provides for a 25% pay rise over four years for its workers. It will upset the sector's highly profitable business model on the other side of the Atlantic.

title: France calls Israeli strike on the French institute in Gaza incomprehensible
summary: Israeli authorities informed France that the French Institute of Gaza was targeted in an Israeli strike, the French Foreign Ministry said on Friday.

title: Ukraine, Gaza and Nagorno-Karabakh: Three interacting wars
summary: In the Caucasus, the Donbas, and the Middle East, these ongoing conflicts have a territorial dimension, but also one of identity and social cohesion. The United States and Europe may have to reinvent themselves in order to save democracy.

title: 'Spamalot', the Monty Python-style musical comedy comes to Paris
summary: At the Théâtre de Paris, Pierre-François Martin-Laval is presenting a new adaptation of the show based on the film 'Monty Python and the Holy Grail.'

title: Israel resists US pressure for humanitarian pause to allow more aid to Gaza
summary: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said to US Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Friday that there would be no ceasefire until some 240 hostages were released.

title: Tunisian President Kais Saied objects proposed law criminalizing normalization with Israel
summary: Parliament on Thursday debated a bill that would punish the "crime of normalization" with between six and 10 years in prison, with life imprisonment for repeat offenders.

title: In Argentina, Milei challenges the reality of state terrorism under the dictatorship
summary: Statements made by the far-right candidate in the second round of the presidential election on November 19, and by Victoria Villarruel, who is expected to be his vice-president, are causing concern and have been described as negating the truth by victims' families.

title: Iran sentences woman to death for adultery
summary: Iran faces global scrutiny for its frequent use of the death penalty. UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres on Wednesday said that Iran has executed 419 individuals in the first seven months of this year, marking a 30% increase from the previous year.

title: PSG beat Montpellier to go atop Ligue 1
summary: Reigning champions PSG moved two points clear of Nice of Friday after a defiant 3-0 win at the Parc de Princes.

title: India's Hindu nationalists are using the Israel-Hamas war to their advantage
summary: Since the October 7 Hamas attacks, torrents of false information and Islamophobic rhetoric have proliferated on social media. For the BJP, Prime Minister Narendra Modi's party, Israel represents a model religious nationalist state.

title: Eric Trump testifies in civil fraud trial, says he relied on accountants for financial statements accuracy
summary: The son of Donald Trump testified on Friday that he was relying on accountants to ensure the accuracy of financial statements that authorities say fraudulently exaggerated his father's wealth.

title: Storm Ciaran leaves 10 dead in Europe and major disruption in its wake
summary: The 'meteorological bomb' Ciaran severely disrupted Western Europe, from Spain to the Netherlands, bringing high winds and power outages, and paralyzing transport.

title: Chéri Samba in powerful words and images at the Musée Maillol
summary: The 50 or so paintings on show, belonging to the collector Jean Pigozzi, confirm the singularity of this Congolese painter.

title: South Korea continues to grapple with grief one year after deadly Halloween stampede
summary: The country commemorated the Itaewon tragedy, which claimed 159 lives on October 29, 2022, amid controversy surrounding responsibility and the lack of consideration for victims and their families.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: After the Games, more than 1,600 housing units will go to students
summary: During the competition, Olympic organizers are hoping to use student residences in the Paris region.

title: UN force caught at heart of tensions between Lebanon and Israel
summary: French Defense Minister Sébastien Lecornu visited the base of the French contingent deployed within the United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon on Thursday, as clashes between Hezbollah and the Israeli army are growing in intensity, raising fears of escalation.

title: Germany: Far-right AfD lawmaker suspected of having close ties to neo-Nazi circles
summary: Bavarian MP Daniel Halemba, 22, was arrested following the discovery of suspected Nazi artifacts linked to him.

title: Nepal: Earthquake kills at least 60 people
summary: A strong earthquake shook northwestern Nepal districts just before midnight Friday, and officials said at least 60 people were dead and dozens more injured as rescuers searched mountain villages.

title: Chéri Samba: 'I know how my painting will end'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, the Congolese artist talks about his career and creative process, on the occasion of a retrospective at the Musée Maillol in Paris.

title: Iranian Minister Amir-Abdollahian aspires to lead the 'axis of resistance' against Israel and the United States
summary: Closely aligned with the Revolutionary Guard, the Iranian head of diplomacy takes advantage of his status to travel abroad and speak on behalf of Tehran's allies.

title: Ukraine fears being forgotten amid Middle East conflict
summary: Kyiv is worried that the support from the US and its Western allies will shift in favor of Israel. In an interview in 'The Economist,' the commander-in-chief of the Ukrainian forces, Valery Zaluzhny, gave an alarming assessment of the situation.

title: Explosion at Al-Ahli Hospital in Gaza: New findings from our investigation
summary: Two weeks after the blast, a new analysis by Le Monde shows that the trajectory and speed of a salvo of Palestinian rockets are compatible with the explosion at the hospital. It sheds light on a night of clashes, from exchanged fire to the presence of two fighter jets, seemingly Israeli.

title: The insurmountable failure of France's strategy in the Sahel
summary: 'France-Africa, the breakdown' (2/3). France's overemphasis on the security aspect of its strategy in the West African region, at the expense of supporting the development of various states, led to the failure of a decade of military presence.

title: In East Jerusalem, Gazan cancer patients suffer far from home
summary: More than 200 Gazan patients who could not be treated in the enclave are stuck in two East Jerusalem hospitals.

title: Macron walks a tightrope over the war in Gaza
summary: The French president has been confronted with domestic tensions over the war between Israel and Hamas. He plans to hold a 'humanitarian conference' on November 9.

title: Jason Furman: 'The US  is making progress on some of its most stubborn problems'
summary: Although all the indicators for the US economy are green, persistently high inflation could cast a shadow over the end of President Joe Biden's term, warns the former chairman of Barack Obama's Council of Economic Advisers.
